entry.name: nth-of-type
entry.title: :nth-of-type() Selector

argument.name: index
argument.desc: The index of each child to match, starting with 1, the string even or odd, or an equation ( eg. :nth-of-type(even), :nth-of-type(4n) )

entry.desc: Selects all elements that are the nth child of their parent in relation to siblings with the same element name.

longdesc.p: Because jQuery's implementation of :nth- selectors is strictly derived from the CSS specification, the value of n is "1-indexed", meaning that the counting starts at 1. For other selector expressions such as :eq() or :even jQuery follows JavaScript's "0-indexed" counting.
Further discussion of this usage can be found in the W3C CSS specification.

example.desc: Find each span that is second in relation to its sibling spans.
